result.execSummary:
The defendant Little Wolf Traveling Thunder Lemieux was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Defendant is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Courts Office, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Clerk of Circuit Court Ashland County
201 West Main Street, Room 307
Ashland,WI  54806
Added to current pymt plan.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances(MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores,(any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol), any place where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Defendant is subject to random UA testing.
  The Defendant is to provide a DNA specimen.
  The Defendant is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Defendant.
  The Defendant, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under Wisconsin statutes Sect. 941.29 under the Wisconsin Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under Wisconsin State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
Upon successful completion of the terms/conditions of supervision followed with a letter confirming successful completion from DOC, this record would be expunged!

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
Concurrent with: Ashland County Cases 13CF161,15CF74,15CF109 but CONSECUTIVE to 14CF199

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
Concurrent with: Ashland County Cases 13CF161,15CF74 and 15CF109 but CONSECUTIVE to 14CF199

Court grants expungment of this record -if- after one year, the financial obligations have been paid in full and in a timely manner and there is no further criminal activity.
It is the Defendant's responsibility to petition the court for expungment.
